text: Hi, my name is Claudia Pienica.

I'm between my first and second
year doing an MS/MBA Biotech
at Harvard.
So this is a new joint degree.

We're the first cohort where I'm
doing both the MBA at Harvard

Business School but I'm also
doing a master in biotechnology

at the Graduate School of
Arts and Sciences and Harvard
Medical School.

So a little bit
about who I am: I
grew up in Belgium in Antwerp.

Let me take a step
back and explain

why I was even interested
in the MS/MBA Biotech.

So I initially was not thinking
about doing business school.
I missed the science.
I love science.

I learned a lot at McKinsey
about business and strategy.
But I really missed the science.

And I felt that to be a
successful professional

in the health care
industry, I wanted

to get closer to
the science again.

So I was planning to do
a biomedical engineering
master's.

And I applied to
multiple schools.

And that year, I still
remember a few colleagues

sending me actually a
note that hey, Harvard has
started its MS/MBA Biotech.

That sounds like a
perfect fit because it

takes both your scientific
background and your McKinsey

experience, which is
business, and puts it together

and tries to think
about how you utilize

both skills and
both lenses to bring

extremely interesting science
to patients and drive impact.
So I applied to that as well.
I didn't think I would get in.
And I did.
And it's amazing.
[JAZZ MUSIC PLAYING]
